intro: Radicula islandica, commonly known as the Iceland liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Marchantiaceae. It is a small, leafy plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal areas and mountainous regions. The plant has a thalloid structure, which consists of a flat, ribbon-like body that lacks true roots, stems, and leaves. Radicula islandica plays an important role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its habitat. Its ability to tolerate harsh conditions makes it a resilient species in extreme environments.
